Ukrainian soldiers' rotations on the front line are growing ever longer
subhead: The Cross of Military Merit, awarded by President Zelensky to two soldiers who held their position for 165 days, highlights the rising difficulty of rotating infantrymen under constant threat from Russian drones.

'With Grokipedia, AI will be trained using the world as Elon Musk describes, perceives and desires it'
subhead: In an op-ed for Le Monde, Julien Malaurent, the deputy managing director of ESSEC Business School, warns of the consequences that could result from the launch of Grokipedia, Elon Musk's encyclopedia. Entirely generated by artificial intelligence, the platform heralds an epistemological revolution.

title: Mission Congress, an ambitious Catholic gathering with a wide range of sometimes controversial guests
subhead: The Accor Arena is hosting Mission Congress on Friday and Saturday in Paris, an event that declares itself a 'mission of evangelization' and seeks to bring together all branches of the Catholic Church.

title: 'It's alive!': On Netflix, Guillermo del Toro breathes energy and beauty into the myth of 'Frankenstein'
subhead: The Mexican filmmaker distills the essence of his cinema in this inspired take on Mary Shelley's novel.

title: Chinese automaker BYD shows outsized global ambitions
subhead: The world's leading electric vehicle manufacturer showcases its technological prowess and determination to conquer foreign markets at its massive Zhengzhou factory, which employs 57,000 people.

'Made in France' clothing manufacturers struggle to survive amid competition from fast fashion
subhead: French brands are struggling to keep their factories running and sell their products, squeezed by competition from low-cost fast fashion brands like the Chinese giant Shein. To survive, some are turning to direct sales online.

title: Marlene Dumas becomes first contemporary woman artist to join the Louvre's permanent collection
subhead: She has exhibited her work in the world's most prestigious museums and her paintings have broken auction records. The Dutch-South African painter has created a body of work shaped by the traumas of her time. At 72, she joins the Louvre with a series of nine portraits. This event illustrates the shift sought by Louvre Director Laurence des Cars, one that she is maintaining even after the institution was the target of a dramatic jewelry heist.

title: In 'Slide,' a cowboy and his guitar restore justice in Oregon
subhead: In his new animated film, American director Bill Plympton delivers a western of extraordinary fluidity, drawn entirely in ink pen.
